titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Leland Stanford, Jr., Collection SC0033C
titlestmt.author: Processed by Patricia White; machine-readable finding aid created by Patricia White

publicationstmt.publisher: Department of Special Collections and University Archives

note.p: This encoded finding aid is compliant with Stanford EAD Best Practice Guidelines, Version 1.0.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2017-02-08 14:43:43 -0800.

repository.corpname: Department of Special Collections and University Archives

did.unittitle: Leland Stanford, Jr., collection

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Correspondence, journal, notebooks, drawings, personality studies, and school work of Leland Jr., and condolences to Senator and Mrs. Stanford regarding the death of their son. The correspondence and journal relate primarily to family travels in Europe and activities at home in San Francisco and Palo Alto, to his interests in archeology and collecting, and to his education. The collection also includes correspondence between Jane Lathrop Stanford and William T. Ross, one of Leland Jr.'s tutors.

bioghist.head: Biography
bioghist.p: Leland Stanford, Jr., the only child of Senator and Mrs. Leland Stanford, was born in Sacramento, California on May 14, 1868. His early death in March 1884 just before his sixteenth birthday inspired the founding of Leland Stanford Junior University in 1885.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation:
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Leland Stanford, Jr., Collection (SC0033C). Dept. of Special Collections and University Archives, Stanford University Libraries, Stanford, Calif.

custodhist.head: Provenance
custodhist.p: Gifts of Jane Lathrop Stanford, Thomas Welton Stanford, David Starr Jordan, Helen Stanford Canfield, David H. Canfield, and others; also includes purchases.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: Property rights reside with the repository. Literary rights reside with the creators of the documents or their heirs. To obtain permission to publish or reproduce, please contact the Public Services Librarian of the Dept. of Special Collections and University Archives.

did.unittitle: Leland Stanford, Jr. papers
Outgoing correspondence,
to J. T. Wilson, wants small boiler for stationary engine
to Mr. Wilson re railroad car, laying track
to Harry Farrington, Jr., re railroad on Palo Alto estate
to Wilson Taylor ("Friend Wilsy") re snow ball fights with Wellington on Sierra Nevada trip
to Wilse re "Kearny is raising the Dickens out West," bicycling in Albany, NY, visit to "penitentiary"
to Friend "Wiltsy" re Albany bicycle club, dog "Cootsey"
to Leland Stanford re Berlin, "Dom Cathedral," royalty, Markat painting
(Nice, France) to Leland Stanford re silk factory in Lyons, making velvet
Outgoing correspondence,
to Leland Stanford re Rome sightseeing
to Mrs. Dyer Lathrop re Rome, King's birthday, audience with Pope (with cover)
Leland Stanford re visit to Pompeii, excavations there, going to Vesuvius tomorrow
(Frankfurt) to Aunt Kate re autumn military maneuvers in Hamburg
to Joey Stanford re prescription for paint for engine, photo (with cover)
to Friend Wilsie re mechanical troubles on RR trip to San Diego
to Friend Wilsie re New York theater, Timothy Hopkins wedding, please check on puppies and horses
Outgoing correspondence,
to Wilsey wants news of puppies, sick with a cold, troubles with horses and carriages in New York City ALS, (mss copy and typescript copy)
to "Joe" [Josiah Winslow Stanford ?] re steam boat and steam engines, with sketches
(New York) to Wilsie re Union League Club fire
to Wilsie re his London address
to Aunt Kate re R. M. S. "Germanie" voyage, Leland and Jane Stanford ill, wants news of his dog Toots
to Miss Hull re London, Jane and Leland Stanford ill, have had only one row
to Wilsie re London sightseeing
Outgoing correspondence,
to Aunt Kate re bicycles, future machine shop at home, London sightseeing
to Uncle Ariel asking to have his things looked after
(Paris) to Aunt Kate re Jane Stanford's illness
(Le Havre) to Leland Stanford re life in their hotel, taking German lessons
(Le Havre) to Leland Stanford re drunk coachman fell of the box, hired his own phaeton and horse, lessons
(Le Havre) to Leland Stanford re Jane Stanford's health, Miss Hart here to keep her company
Outgoing correspondence
(Le Havre) to Leland Stanford re Jane Stanford better, he's still swimming
(Le Havre) to Leland Stanford re Jane Stanford's health, leaving next week
(Le Havre) to Leland Stanford re Jane Stanford improving, he goes 5 miles to get her milk from local farm
(Le Havre) to Leland Stanford re Jane Stanford's birthday, weather hot
(Le Havre) to Leland Stanford re Jane Stanford's health, Dr. stopped the mercury treatments
(Le Havre) to Leland Stanford re delayed leaving to visit with Tillotsons
Outgoing correspondence
(Paris) to Leland Stanford re arrived in Paris, went to Hippodrome, attended fete for the poor in Tuilleries
(Paris) to Miss Hull re getting along moderately in his lessons, dog Toots in California has become a vagabond, Jane Stanford enjoyed her birthday card
(Paris) to Leland Stanford re he and Jane attending theater last night
(Paris) to Leland Stanford re thinks Jane would recover better in Palo Alto, taking German and gymnastic lessons
to Leland Stanford re taking drive in "Bois" and going to theater, would like to go to Homburg
Outgoing correspondence,
(Paris) to Leland Stanford re buying things for museum
(Paris) to Leland Stanford re Jane Stanford's health worse, couldn't do proposed trip to Constantinople
(Paris) to Uncle Ariel re trip to Bordeaux to see Wine Making at Chateau La Fette, glad to hear of success of horses
(Vienna) to Aunt Kate re cities and sights so far, not all the houses were put on map of the farm, to dine with Mr. Taft the American Minister
(Naples) to Miss Hull re Christmas in Vienna, crossing Danube on ice, Constantinople meeting with Sultan's Aide-de-camp, met Schliemann in Athens
Incoming correspondence,
L. B. di Cesnola to Sir Philip Cunliffe Owens introducing Leland Stanford Jr.,
Lizzie Hull re her activities in Chicago, his arguments with Mr. Nash,
Wm. Sherman re acquiring C. P. medal,
Leland Stanford re meeting in Homburg, his health,
Leland Stanford re his health,
Leland Stanford re bad weather in Homburg, soon they will all be heading home to Palo Alto,
Wilson G. Taylor, birthday card,
Wilson G. Taylor re Leland's dogs and horse, likes his dog cart, snow storm in San Francisco,
Wilson G. Taylor re Leland's dog sick, art school,
Wilson G. Taylor re snow, being in art school and his plans to study in Europe,
Woodbury & Haley re Leland Jr. and Mr. Nash attending Heald's Business College,
Frank [?] re leaving business for college, hopes to hear from him soon,
Workbook, German lessons, French lessons, doodling, stamps, description of Colosseum, Pompeii, handwriting practice
Cash accounts,
Logbook from European trip

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Entries include remarks on way of life, arrival of Mr. Nash (new teacher), father sitting for Meissonnier, assassination of President Garfield. Handwriting varies, some entries possibly written by Nash.
